chapter.title: Keeping your System up-to-date and beyond

sect1.title: Keeping the System up-to-date
sect1.para: Computers are supposed to be used, people need them for work and play, you should not have to spend all your time fixing and updating it. At the same time is keeping your system up-to-date a must. You cannot just leave your computer as it is. Especially if you are connected to the internet then you need to install at least security updates. Ubuntu makes this really simple.

sect1.title: Upgrading your system to the next version of Ubuntu
sect1.para: Imagene that you are completely satisfied with the way you have setup your computer. You spent considarable time making it look just like you want. You added wallpapers and made folders, you installed programs and configured them, basically you're finally satisfied. And now all of a sudden comes this new version of Ubuntu. What to do? Stay with your old system or start from scratch? Don't worry there is hope. It's called Dist-upgrade.

It is possible to install from one version of Ubuntu to the next. For this to work you need to be able to get all the new packages, usually from internet, and you need o do some configuring. What do you need to change?
Open the repository editor with Preferences Repositories from the menu.

Choose your main Ubuntu repository (like in the screenshot). In the screenshot you see "Warty", this you change to the next version of Ubuntu, for example Hoary. Do the same with all the other repository entries.
Press Ok and update your package-list (Click on Reload in the toolbar). When you now press applicationly, your system will be updated to the next version of Ubuntu. This will take a while.

note.para: Synaptic might ask several questions, read those carefully.
